byline.contributor: Rick Rojas reported from Constable, and J. David Goodman and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Reporting was contributed by Kirk Semple from Constable, Sarah Maslin Nir from Malone, and Thomas Kaplan, Benjamin Mueller and Michael Schwirtz from New York.
byline.original: By RICK ROJAS, J. DAVID GOODMAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

abstract: New York State Trooper, Sgt Jay Cook, shoots second Clinton Correctional facility escapee David Sweat and takes him into custody, ending 23-day manhunt; final confrontation occurs in rain-drenched woods near Canadian border after Cook spotted Sweat jogging down road and attempted to question him; Sweat remains in critical condition, but his survival raises hopes of learning more about how he and Richard W Matt managed complex escape.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sweat, 35, a murderer who had been serving a sentence of life without parole, was in critical condition at Albany Medical Center late Sunday night.

headline.main: David Sweat, Escaped New York Convict, Is Shot and Captured as Hunt Ends
headline.print_headline: Sprawling Hunt Ends as 2nd Escapee Is Shot by New York Trooper

snippet: Mr. Sweat, 35, a murderer who had been serving a sentence of life without parole, was in critical condition at Albany Medical Center late Sunday night.
